festival.introText:
Big Family Festival has gone from strength to strength its a festival for families ran by a family. Husband and wife team George and Angela, pride themselves on putting on an event that all the family can enjoy but their main focus remains on their original ethos and aim a Family Festival that really caters for children of all ages.

 

Be part of the family

Invest in your memories

Big Family Festival

  • Camping & Glamping
  • Day tickets & weekend tickets
  • Tribute acts & bands
  • Character meet & greets
  • Family Bingo
  • Street dance workshops
  • DJ workshops
  • Lip Sync Battles
  • Slime School
  • Craft workshops
  • Sports zone
  • Drama workshops
  • TV Talent Show Acts
  • Karaoke
  • Little ones garden
  • Reading Corner
  • Award winning street food
  • Circus skills
  • Gin Festival
festival.descriptionText: Skiddle is an official ticket outlet of Big Family Festival 2023. Get Big Family Festival tickets, news and information with Skiddle.com
festival.location: Sutton Coldfield and Surrounding Areas in Sutton Coldfield

reviews.title: Review of Big Family Festival
reviews.body: over priced even to get in avoid!

reviews.title: Review of Big Family Festival
reviews.body: over priced everything was spaced apart far away small stage show kids could barely see won't be taking the family again extortion prices to get in and then over priced rides food even a small amount of face glitter was over priced

reviews.title: Review of Big Family Festival
reviews.body: this event in its entirety was mis sold. the limited amateur acts were repeated a number of times on the 1 stage. soft play, sports zone etc were just not there. camping was abysmal no water supply, porta loos with no supplies. no hand wash facilities, no sanitising stations, no cooking area, pot holes in the ground that were unseen due to length of grass. I believe everyone who booked and paid through skiddle should be entitled to claim a full refund as the event advertised was certainly not what was delivered.

reviews.title: Review of Big Family Festival
reviews.body: We had a great time, lots of activities and acts, could be a little better organised in terms of timings and communication but we really enjoyed ourselves.

reviews.title: Review of Big Family Festival
reviews.body: Absolutely awful! Not even half of the things advertised were there. Free parking was advertised and then was forced to pay Â£5 per car to park! Would not recommend and would not go again!

reviews.title: Review of Big Family Festival
reviews.body:
the camp site was a straw field that wasn't suitable for camping. we camped as a group and everyone's legs ended up cut from the grass. no hand washing or alcohol gel available. the cooking area was just a gavel patch with no facilities at all. 
 nearly all advertised activities (soft play, ballet, dance work shop, bingo, table tennis, badminton, ride-ons...to name a few) weren't there. lucky if I counted 20 activities hardly the 100+ activities advertised 
4 stalls to look at, acts weren't the greatest, tho my daughter did enjoy frozen and duggee. 
as for the stewards.....2 stood laughing and taking piss of my group after the person thr gate told us to drive past the red tent and not the blue which us through the site as it was setting up on Friday morning. I did here then and confronted them pointing out that some signage wouldn't go amiss as nothing had signs. the organisers were helpful....the showers wasn't really there fault and when I explained how my daughter had been sick and could they let me know when they are planning to turn the showers on, both were very helpful and that was the only direct dealing I had with them. 
overall not really what was advertised so wouldn't return unless vast improvements made.

faqs.question: When is Big Family Festival 2023?
faqs.answer: Big Family Festival takes place on Friday 4th August - Sunday 6th August 2023.

faqs.question: How do I get to Big Family Festival?
faqs.answer: Big Family Festival takes place at Dunton Hall, Kingsbury Rd, Curdworth, Sutton Coldfield B76 0BA.

faqs.question: Is there disability access and PA Tickets?
faqs.answer:
We are committed to making Big Family Festival as accessible as possible and great efforts are being been made to achieve this where reasonable.

There are of course still fields and areas where mobility can be difficult.  We have spaces to chill out and get away from it all as well, for those who need this.

However, Big Family Festival is an outdoor festival utilising fields and farmland that could pose problems, particularly in wet weather for mobility, and large volumes of people and noise for those with learning difficulties. With a little help here and there though we feel that it is definitely manageable and we provide a 2 for 1 pass for Personal Assistants for those who may find they have physical and mental challenges across the weekend.

Please read the following information carefully.

2 FOR 1 – ONE FREE DISABILITY ACCESS PERSONAL ASSISTANT PASS

In our commitment to make Big Family Festival accessible to everyone, we may provide Deaf or disabled ticket holders that would be unable to attend without use of a personal assistant (PA), and are in receipt of one, or more of the following with a ticket at no additional cost for one PA:

•    - Middle or Higher rate DLA for care and/or mobility

•    - Receipt of Personal Independence Payment (PIP)

•    - Evidence of being severely sight impaired

•    - CredAbility Access Card – + 1 category requirement

•    - A recognised Assistance Dog ID Card.

HOW TO APPLY

• - Please email angela@bigfamilyfestival.co.uk

Providing proof of one of the above along with the your ticket order number, for the ticket already purchased.

A assistance ticket will then be sent which is the same value/date/type as the one purchased.

The deadline for assistance ticket requests is 15th July 2022.

faqs.question: How much are Big Family Festival tickets?
faqs.answer: Please scroll up to view the latest ticket prices.

faqs.question: How much is car parking?
faqs.answer: Please note there is a £5 car parking charge payable upon arrival (in the BY Car - car park is on site).

faqs.question: Does Big Family Festival have any age restrictions?
faqs.answer: There are no age restrictions for The Big Family Festival as it is a family event.

faqs.question: What happens If I bought a ticket and cannot attend?
faqs.answer: Unfortunately we can’t issue you with a refund if you can’t make the event due to work commitments or your mates have dropped out. In these circumstances, we advise passing on your tickets privately to avoid losing out on the money spent.

faqs.question: Where is Big Family Festival?
faqs.answer: Big Family Festival is located at Dunton Hall, Kingsbury Rd, Curdworth, Sutton Coldfield B76 0BA.

faqs.question: Are fair rides included in the ticket price?
faqs.answer: Fair Rides will need to be paid for separately at the event, as these are not included in the cost of your ticket.

location.address: All areas of Sutton Coldfield and surrounding areas

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of Big Family Festival
reviewsDisplayFour.body: We had a great time, lots of activities and acts, could be a little better organised in terms of timings and communication but we really enjoyed ourselves.

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of Big Family Festival
reviewsDisplayFour.body:
A really great weekend had by all. Having been a festival goer from the age of 16 until having children I really wanted to relive the old festival going days,without spending a fortune,to see how the children got on with it. Big family festival did not disappoint. There was a lovely mixture of kids entertainment intermingled with popular music that people of all ages could enjoy. Yes there were rides that cost money and there wasnât a huge selection of food vendors but the prices were reasonable for a festival. If we had gone to one of the bigger, more commercial festivals we would have been looking at spending Â£700 minimum for the four of us before weâd even arrived and then would have had to spend money on food in the arena. Here it cost less than Â£200 for us all to camp for the weekend and go in. The campsite was so close to the main stage that it was also easy to get back to the tent and eat and drink food that had been bought with us. 

All in all we had a great time, the kids loved the circus skills, the slime workshop and meeting their favourite characters and we loved being able to have a laid back drink with friends while listening to music. We will definitely be back next year!

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of Big Family Festival
reviewsDisplayFour.body: Had an amazing weekend with lots of things for the family to do. can't wait for next year âºï¸

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of Big Family Festival
reviewsDisplayFour.body: thanks so much you worked so hard hope you do another one next year it was our third time coming

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of Big Family Festival
reviewsDisplayFour.body: we had a great time thank you

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of Big Family Festival
reviewsDisplayFour.body:
Had a fantastic day with the whole family. This event is awesome and caters perfectly for younger children with a variety of activities that keep them entertained and engaged for the whole time.

Although this year we only visited for the one day we have already decided next year we will be attending for the whole weekend, and we can't wait.

On the whole everything was priced reasonably, in comparison to other festival events attended, with one exception, the fair ground rides, these prices were a little inflated for the quality of what was on offer.

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of Big Family Festival
reviewsDisplayFour.body: Had an amazing time will be on the calender for next year 😀

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of Big Family Festival
reviewsDisplayFour.body: We had an amazing weekend, kids loved it and didnt want to come home
